column4: i want ppl to make changes, i just want t away to revert changes back
some graphic cards don't work properly
there's partition magic, but I haven't tried ubuntu's package of it.
would that prevent changes from being saved
I found some third party software called Deep Freeze, but it says it's for SUSE
no, it would back up the partition. You could restore it later to go back.

:-\ that sounds more complex, this is a computer lab and they have classes all day long and it would be easier to have it revert back to a default image automatically after every reboot kinda like Deep Freeze (by farconics) and Microsoft's Steady State
oh, then a more simple fix if you don't want to retain the student's information would be with lvm
you'd make a snapshot, then mount the snapshot rw
wow... that sounds like what I want jimcooncat
have logout destroy the snapshot, optionally backing up portions of it first
that sounds good
downside to this is they'll lose their work on a power outage
that's fine...
they generally save to Flash drive anyways
it's a bit of a pain to set up, but once you do you won't have to mess with it, and it's fast fast
does ubuntu have directions for setting something like this up jimcooncat
I don't see any ubuntu docs that do what I'm describing here :-(
ah

:-\... i was thinking that an option would be to setup a server that holds the boot image have all the computers boot from that image. Then have the server configured to automatically recreate the boot image every day
maybe by pulling it from  another server
do you think something like that would work jimcooncat
yes, I do. You'd want to look for documentation on mounting lvm read-write snapshots -- not backup.
